title: ISic004429. ISic004429
body:
Facsimile Images

[---]τ̣οι κυβοῖ[τις]

Apparatus criticus

Text after Arena 1989 (IGASM I) with changes based on Gallavotti edition ; Calderone, Jeffery: --]οι Κλεοι[? / Κυβοι[? ; Garducci: ---]το͂ι Κύβο̄ι ; Lejeune: [datif d’anthroponyme] + το͂ι Κυβοί[ο ; Gallavotti: Μυρ]το̄ὶ Κυβοῖ[τις ; Manni Piraino: [---]τ̣οικκυβοι[---]

English translation

no translation applicable

Italian translation

no translation applicable

commentary

According to Manni Piraino (1975), the object does not have the size and characteristics to be interpreted as a funerary stele. However, the fragmentary nature of the document and the state of preservation of the support do not allow us to come to any definite conclusion, nor therefore to exclude that it is a stele. The inscription may contain an ethnic name derived from the toponym Κύβος, an African site near Utica. This reconstruction, suggested by Gallavotti, would have interesting historical implications on the frequentation of Sicily in the Archaic period by people from North Africa. According to Gallavotti the first part could be integrated with the name of a woman, such as Μυρτώι, Κιττώι, Καλλιστώι, Τιτώι and the like.

I.3 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001881 Guarducci 1967 316, fig. 154 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10000193 Guarducci 1964-1965 475, pl. 28.12 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001927 Jeffery 1990 276 no.29 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10000678 Jeffery 1961 276 no.29 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10000677 Calderone NSA 1949 198ff., fig. 6 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10002503
